linuxMode.name: Hardware mode
linuxMode.description: Choose the hardware used to connect to the 1-wire network

owfs.name: OWFS mode
owfs.description: Recommanded mode. Use OWFS (see http://owfs.org for more information). This mode supports most of 1-wire devices, but needs an adapter supported by OWFS. OWFS must be correctly configured (see Yadoms wiki page for how to configure OWFS).

mountPoint.name: OWFS mount point
mountPoint.description: The OWFS mount point on Yadoms server. See your owfs.conf file (generally set to /mnt/1wire).

kernel.name: Kernel mode
kernel.description: Use the kernel native 1-wire support. This mode supports only a few devices (see Yadoms wiki pages for more information). 1-wire devices can be directly connected on a GPIO pin (no adapter required).

mountPoint.name: Mount point
mountPoint.description: The mount point on Yadoms server (generally set to /sys/bus/w1/devices).
